sel.util.color



class Color;
Container for an rgba colour.

Example:
Color c = new Color(255, 0, 0);
c.blue = 255;
assert(c == new Color(255, 0, 255));


pure nothrow @nogc @safe this(ubyte r, ubyte g, ubyte b, ubyte a = 255);
Constructs a colour using rgb(a) values (in range 0..255). By default alpha is 0% transparent (255).

@safe this(Color[] colors);
Creates the average colour of the given one.

Example:
assert(new Color([new Color(200, 0, 0), new Color(0, 200, 0)]) == new Color(100, 100, 0));


pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe uint rgb();
pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe uint rgba();
pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe uint argb();
Encodes the colour as an unsigned integer to be used in the network operations or to be saved.

pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe bool transparent();
Checks if the colour is completely transparent (with the alpha channel equals to 0).

Example:
assert(!new Color(0, 0, 0, 1).transparent);
assert(Colors.TRANSPARENT.transparent);


pure nothrow @nogc @property @safe bool transparent(bool transparent);
Sets the colour as transparent (with alpha = 0) or opaque (with alpha = 255).

bool opEquals(Object o);
Compares two colours.

Returns:
true if red, green, blue an alpha are equals, false otherwise

static pure @safe Color fromString(string c);
Converts and hexadecimal representation of a colour into a Color object.

Returns:
a Color object or null if the string's length is invalid

Throws:
ConvException if one of the string is not an hexadecimal number

Example:
assert(Color.fromString("00CC00").green == 204);
assert(Color.fromString("123456").rgb == 0x123456);
assert(Color.fromString("01F") == Color.fromString("0011FF"));


static pure nothrow @safe Color fromRGB(uint c);
Converts an rgb-encoded integer to a Color.

Example:
assert(Color.fromRGB(0x0000FF).blue == 255);
assert(Color.fromRGB(0x111111).green == 17);


interface Colorable;
Interface for object that have colours.

Example:
if(cast(Colorable)object) {
   object.to!Colorable.color = Color(1, 100, 5);
}


abstract @property @safe Color color();
Gets the current colour.

Example:
if(object.color is null || object.color.transparent) {
   writeln("There's no colour!");
}


abstract @property @safe Color color(Color color);
Sets the colour for this object.

Example:
if(object.color is null) {
   object.color = Color.fromString("003311");
}


class Colors;
Useful collection of colours to be used for dying, choosing block's colours and colouring maps.

Example:
leatherHelmet.color = Colors.cocoa;

world[0, 64, 0] = Blocks.wool[Colors.Wool.brown];
